removals.reasoning: Extra parentheses around a cast expression are redundant; a cast already binds tightly.

Both the outermost parentheses and the inner set around the cast result are unnecessary; casts bind tightly, and function arguments do not need extra wrapping.

Parentheses around the entire array index expression are unnecessary; [] already delimit the expression.

removals.expression: (ey[(i * ny + j)] - (FDTD_E_UPDATE_COEFF * (hz[(i * ny + j)] - hz[((i - 1) * ny + j)])))
removals.replacement: ey[(i * ny + j)] - (FDTD_E_UPDATE_COEFF * (hz[(i * ny + j)] - hz[((i - 1) * ny + j)]))
removals.reasoning: Outermost parentheses around the RHS are unnecessary; assignment does not require grouping.

removals.replacement: FDTD_E_UPDATE_COEFF * (hz[(i * ny + j)] - hz[((i - 1) * ny + j)])
removals.reasoning: Parentheses around a product are unnecessary because * has higher precedence than the surrounding -.
Parentheses around the entire array index expression are unnecessary.
Extra parentheses around the index expression are unnecessary inside []. The inner (i - 1) is still required to bind before *.
Parentheses around the entire array index expression are unnecessary.

removals.expression: (ex[(i * ny + j)] - (FDTD_E_UPDATE_COEFF * (hz[(i * ny + j)] - hz[((i * ny + j) - 1)])))
removals.replacement: ex[(i * ny + j)] - (FDTD_E_UPDATE_COEFF * (hz[(i * ny + j)] - hz[((i * ny + j) - 1)]))
removals.reasoning: Outermost parentheses around the RHS are unnecessary.

removals.replacement: FDTD_E_UPDATE_COEFF * (hz[(i * ny + j)] - hz[((i * ny + j) - 1)])
removals.reasoning: Parentheses around a product are unnecessary due to operator precedence.
